description: Issue #164: Fix parser failures on pr-136-example.pdf and pr-138-example.pdf

userStories.title: Fix parse error on pr-136-example.pdf
userStories.description: pr-136-example.pdf fails to parse entirely. Python pdfplumber extracts 6 pages, 5182 chars, 438 words from this PDF. Diagnose the parse error by opening the PDF and examining the error. Fix the parser to handle whatever construct causes the failure. This PDF is a table detection regression test from the Python pdfplumber project.
acceptanceCriteria: Text extraction produces chars (Python expects 5182 chars across 6 pages)
No regression on existing tests: cargo test --workspace passes
userStories.notes: Test: crates/pdfplumber/tests/real_world_cross_validation.rs (rw_pr_136). This PDF has table structures - the parse error may be related to complex path operators or content stream constructs used in table borders.

userStories.title: Fix parse error on pr-138-example.pdf
userStories.description: pr-138-example.pdf fails to parse entirely. Python pdfplumber extracts 2 pages, 10635 chars, 1834 words, 861 lines, 316 rects, and 4 tables. Diagnose and fix the parse error. This PDF likely shares the same root cause as pr-136-example.pdf but may have additional issues due to its more complex structure.
acceptanceCriteria: Text extraction produces chars (Python expects 10635 chars across 2 pages)
No regression on existing tests: cargo test --workspace passes
userStories.notes: Test: crates/pdfplumber/tests/real_world_cross_validation.rs (rw_pr_138). If the fix for pr-136-example.pdf also fixes this one, mark both stories as passes. 316 rects and 4 tables suggest complex graphical content.
